column4: Alright my CD-drive must not work. I wrote the ISO to it, turned Autorun back on, restarted my computer, and Ubuntu isn't installing.
have you set your computer to book from the CD ?
To book from the CD? I don't believe I have ^_^;;
Oh! Boot from the CD, right? Umm...I do that somehow lol. I haven't yet, but it's possible?
this would be better done from the BIOS.
I'm just smiling at my "book" typo.
Alright. Now I have to figure out what the BIOS is.
when you start the computer, you probably have access to a menu.
Yeah, that's what I was thinking.
So I reboot, press f2 or whatever, then go into boot from CD?
(actually, the appropriate term is "Bios Configuration Menu")
you'll probably have a menu offering to change many settings.
